name: Tock
domains: God of Absolute Order, Writing, and Mechanical Things
worshippers:
Tock is worshiped by craftsman and inventors, particularly among the gnomes of Stagenheim, whom he has blessed with great knowledge and skill with crafts.

The clergy of Tock are usually great craftsman in their own right, and his temple provides a bounty for particularly interesting ideas so that their inventors can build and test them.
appearance: Tock has the appearance of a living machine in the shape of a halfling or gnome.  He is studded with exposed gears and wires, and wears only a monacle.  He is typically seen carrying one or more thick tomes and is often writing furiously in one or more of them.
tenets: one should enrich oneself by taking advantage of the laws and forces of the universe to create new and interesting things.
Books are holy things, and should never be destroyed.
One should write a detailed record of all they learn for future generations
lore: Tock is the father of the Modrons, small mechanical beings that build things, as well as the Inevitables, a group of incredibly powerful constructs that enforce the order of the universe.
